fields.message: We know waiting for answers can be stressful. This report summarizes what we’ve learned so far and what comes next so you can feel informed and supported.

fields.sources_summary: Medical records shared with Defiant Health as of 11/06/2025

notes.limitations: We can only review the test results and doctor notes that were provided to us.
notes.disclaimer: This report is for informational purposes and not medical advice.

tumors.title: Tumor 1
tumors.cancer_type_explanation: Invasive ductal carcinoma (IDC) is the most common type of breast cancer. In simple terms, it started in the milk ducts (DCIS) and has now grown slightly outside of the ducts (IDC).
tumors.location_explanation: The tumor is small—less than a centimeter, or about the size of a dime. The initial tests show no signs of spread to the lymph nodes, which is often a positive sign for successful outcome for women who have a similar cancer profile.
tumors.stage_explanation: Stage I breast cancer is considered early-stage cancer. This means the tumor is small and has not spread to lymph nodes or other parts of the body, which is associated with a good prognosis.
tumors.grade_explanation: The Nottingham Grade is a grading system used to describe how much the cancer cells look like normal cells and how quickly they are growing. Grade 2 is considered intermediate—not the slowest, but also not the fastest or most aggressive.
tumors.hormone_receptor_status_explanation: Your cancer is hormone receptor positive, which means it is fueled by hormones. You can think of these hormones as "food" for the cancer cells. This means the primary, highly effective long-term treatment will be anti-hormone pills (endocrine therapy) to "starve" the cancer.
tumors.her2_status_explanation: Patients with HER2 negative status do not overproduce the HER2 protein and typically do not need the specific, targeted medications designed for HER2-positive cancer.
tumors.notes: Findings are consistent with the diagnosis summary.

whatThisMeans.goodNews: We have a clear diagnosis and early treatment plan.
whatThisMeans.newOptions: Further testing or consultation may refine the plan.
whatThisMeans.treatmentFocus: Focus will be on targeted or endocrine therapy based on results.
whatThisMeans.otherConsiderations: Discuss final pathology and genetic testing with your oncologist.

fields.summary: These are the most likely treatments based on your diagnosis and subtype.
